title: Toni Collette Is Also a Fan of John Early’s Toni Collette Impersonation
text:
Is there a more beautiful fandom arc than John Early’s eternal love for Toni Collette? The comedian, who ran a fan website for Collette as a teenager and got the opportunity to give the actor a birthday collage he made for her as a kid last year, has another thing to be proud of today: Toni has confirmed that she is, like us, a big fan of John’s impersonation of her. During his show last night, Seth Meyers played a clip for Collette from 2017, in which Early shows off his perfect take on Collette’s iconic “Do I make her proud?” line from The Sixth Sense. “He’s hilarious,” Collette tells Meyers. “Next time you can do an impression of him,” Meyers suggests, to which Collette replies, “Very gladly, actually.”

Here’s the clip of Early when he was on Late Night again, just in case you want to watch the master at work for a second time:

You’ve never seen an impression of Toni Collette in the Sixth Sense quite like @bejohnce’s. pic.twitter.com/hI3P88TP2V — Late Night with Seth Meyers (@LateNightSeth) June 7, 2017
description: On NBC’s ‘Late Night,’ Seth Meyers showed guest Toni Collette a clip of comedian John Early’s impersonation of her. She’s a fan, of course.
